title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
I have 8.5V o/p, Seems like boosting is not occurring, Changed the driver IC, The feedback is proper (Checked the continuity from D7701 second pin to A5). 
I have 2.8V BKL_EN . I am ....STUCKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKK.........................

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
If is not secret, can we know what board do you have on the desk???

Did you try known good LCD assembly?
BKL_PWM level?
Try 2-3 times PRAM reset, just in case.,

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
I dont have extra lcd for trial, 
BKL_PWM - Its high If I am not wrong it is 2.1V.
PRAM reset didn't help 
Revealing the secret Board is 820-00165A

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
Check R7717-22; post diode mode to ground on all them.
Also at both pins of D7701.
Post real BKL_PWM level.

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
I have resoldered the backlight chip, Now when I start there is backlight ,,,,
When I reboot no backlight. Once starts then it keeps working. Does it a software issue or I should resolder it again?

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
Did PRAM reset again?
You should be sure to get good solders.

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
I have resoldered properly... Now the backlight is working  ..... Only one issue...

There is 16 different brightness control by pressing the F1 and F2 key (Low to High), Only on the 15th position of brightness does it's flickering. I mean brightness doesn't stay stable. It's slightly flickering.

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message: Should try new backlight chip, U7701.

message:
Seems like back light issue solved...
Now when I press the power button sometimes it boots, sometimes it doesn't boot or no chime sound just Fan is rotating continues, Tried pram reset and Cleanme... Doesnt help

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present

Didn't note this problem before changing U7701?
Shouldn't be caused by this change however.

CPU core comes high, PLT_RESET_L present?

Check for USB activity.
Also post CPU core voltage in this case.

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message: Connected an external SSD ---> Removed the internal SSD ---> System booted properly, But after 3rd restart, it again went to that weird mode (Fan running not booting)----> Measured PPVCC_S0_CPU at weird mode= 1.808V

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
1.8V is correct voltage.
Did you check for USB activity???

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message: Did I answer your question? :rolleyes:

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
Any history fault, liquid sign?
Just in case, try known good BIOS, clean ME.

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message: Didn't try known bios, CleanME doesn't help. No Liquid sign...

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message: Will, it makes sense re soldering the display connecter ? Does SMC_LID control sleep activity?

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
SMC_LID puts system to sleep, when lid is closed.
An incorrect level can cause weird issue; if fluctuates close to its threshold voltage.

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message: Changed the connector, seems like that sleep issue solved ..... Just gone through hw diagnostic test .... Got NDT001 - Issue with the thunder bolt Hardware... Never ending problems😣

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message: You may disable thunderbolt, if nobody needs it.

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message: Can I know the commands for disabling it please?

title: A1466 no backlight , Image is present
message:
If all other functions are good, no need to disable anything.
If no thunderbolt/display port will be used.
Removing Q3080, will let thunderbolt "out of game".
